mlr3mbo v0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • mlr3book

Acquisition Function Expected Improvement Per Second

Source: R/AcqFunctionEIPS.R
AcqFunctionEIPS.Rd

Expected improvement per second.

It is assumed that calculations are performed on an bbotk::OptimInstanceSingleCrit. Additionally to target values of the codomain that should be minimized or maximized, the bbotk::Objective of the bbotk::OptimInstanceSingleCrit should return time values. The id of the column containing the time values must be passed as the time_id argument during construction.

References

Snoek, Jasper, Larochelle, Hugo, Adams, P R (2012). “Practical Bayesian Optimization of Machine Learning Algorithms.” In Pereira F, Burges CJC, Bottou L, Weinberger KQ (eds.), Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems, volume 25, 2951--2959.

See also

Other Acquisition Function: AcqFunctionAEI, AcqFunctionCB, AcqFunctionEI, AcqFunctionPI, AcqFunctionSmsEgo, AcqFunction

Super classes

bbotk::Objective -> bbotk::ObjectiveRFunDt -> mlr3mbo::AcqFunction -> AcqFunctionEIPS

Public fields

y_best

(numeric(1)).

surrogate_time

SurrogateSingleCrit.

Methods

Public methods

  • AcqFunctionEIPS$new()

  • AcqFunctionEIPS$setup()

  • AcqFunctionEIPS$update()

  • AcqFunctionEIPS$update_surrogate()

  • AcqFunctionEIPS$clone()

Inherited methods

  • bbotk::Objective$eval()

Method new()

Creates a new instance of this R6 class.

Usage

AcqFunctionEIPS$new(surrogate, surrogate_time, time_id)

Arguments

surrogate

(SurrogateSingleCrit).

surrogate_time

(SurrogateSingleCrit).

time_id

(character(1)).

Method setup()

Sets up the acquisition function.

Usage

AcqFunctionEIPS$setup(archive)

Arguments

archive

(bbotk::Archive).

Method update()

Updates acquisition function and sets y_best.

Usage

AcqFunctionEIPS$update(archive)

Arguments

archive

(bbotk::Archive).

Method update_surrogate()

Update the Surrogate model(s) with new data. FIXME: probably moves this simply to $update()

Usage

AcqFunctionEIPS$update_surrogate(archive)

Arguments

archive

(bbotk::Archive).

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

AcqFunctionEIPS$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.

Examples

library(bbotk)

#> Loading required package: paradox
library(paradox)
library(data.table)
library(mlr3)
library(mlr3learners)

objective = ObjectiveRFunDt$new(
  fun = function(xdt) data.table(y = xdt$x ^ 2, time = abs(xdt$x)),
  domain = ps(x = p_dbl(lower = -10, upper = 10)),
  codomain = ps(y = p_dbl(tags = "minimize"))
)

instance = OptimInstanceSingleCrit$new(objective, terminator = trm("evals", n_evals = 10L))

learner = lrn("regr.km", covtype = "matern3_2", optim.method = "gen")
surrogate = SurrogateSingleCritLearner$new(learner)
surrogate_time = surrogate$clone(deep = TRUE)

acq_function = AcqFunctionEIPS$new(surrogate, surrogate_time = surrogate_time, time_id = "time")

bayesopt_soo(instance, acq_function)
